definition: with a grunting sound it stops (idiom); to come to an end spontaneously (esp. of sound)
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

sentences.english: Perhaps as the thermal power no longer entanglements, "electricity shortage" is an abrupt end.
sentences.chinese: 或许当火电不再纠结时，“电荒”也就戛然而止。

sentences.english: A moment later, her terrible screams broke off as the train mowed her down.
sentences.chinese: 一瞬间，火车碾过詹妮，骇人的惨叫声戛然而止。

sentences.english: What will they do when the music stops?
sentences.chinese: 乐声戛然而止时，他们又将何去何从？

sentences.english: With no remaining mysteries, the scientific journey would halt.
sentences.chinese: 没有了未解之谜，科学的旅程就戛然而止。

definition: (literary) to stop abruptly (of a sound)/to be loud and clear
end/conclusion/to come to an end/to terminate (sth)
to cut short/to break off/to discontinue/to interrupt
to fix/to confine to/freeze frame/stop motion (filmmaking)
to develop rapidly after abrupt turn (idiom); dramatic change
to arise abruptly/to arrive suddenly/happening suddenly
